result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin L Ptacek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Probation rejected
Probation revoked on DE's own motion

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court, in custody.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 16CM9, 16CM10.  DE has requested a motion hearing to self revoke probation.  DE does not wish to be represented by counsel.  Court instructs on DE w/o counsel.  Court will accept waiver of counsel.  DE will be sentenced to 20 days jail in each case, CC, DNA sample, surcharge, $150.00 fine on Ct 2 in 16CM9, all consecutive.  DE has credit for 42 days served.
Dated 8/09/16 from DOC to Judge Anderson,  re: hearing requested by DE concerning probation
Motion hearing on September 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
DE has indiacted he does not intend to seek PCR
Case settlement

Defendant Kevin L Ptacek in court with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  James D Babbitt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Heard along with 15CM174, 16CM9 and 16CM10.  Court reads agreement.  DE understands his rights and waives his rights.  DE enters NC Plea to all charges.  Court finds DE guilty.  State feels that DE may have an AODA issue.  Withhold sentence, probation 2 yrs in 15CM174 and 2 yrs probation on Ct 1 in 16CM10 and 2 years probation in case 16CM9, concurrent.  Pay fine and court costs in each case and DNA sample and pay surcharge.
